details: C  is a general-purpose computer programming language. It was created in the 1970s by Dennis Ritchie, and remains very widely used.
C++ is a high-level, general-purpose programming language created by Danish computer scientist Bjarne Stroustrup in 1985.
Python is a high-level, general-purpose, functional, object-oriented programming language. Python is dynamically typed and garbage-collected.
Java is a high-level, class-based, object-oriented programming language that is designed to have as few implementation dependencies.
Data structure is a data organization & storage format for access to data & algorithm is a finite sequence of rigorous instructions.
Database Management Systems (DBMS) are software systems used to store, retrieve, and run queries on data interface between an end-user.
